Universal Containers (UC) wants to create a do-it-yourself site for its existing and prospective customers. The site will contain articles, blogs, manuals, and FAQs. Users will be able to ask questions and answer other users’ questions on the site.
Which two Experience Cloud features should UC focus on as it starts building out the site? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Guest user and public access settings

discussion.content:
The correct answers are:

B. Guest user and public access settings
C. Public Site Connect

These features are essential for building a do-it-yourself site for Universal Containers’ customers:

 • Guest user and public access settings: These settings allow content such as articles, blogs, and FAQs to be publicly accessible to both existing and prospective customers without requiring a login.
 • Public Site Connect: This feature helps in creating a community where users can interact by asking and answering questions, enabling customer engagement and peer-to-peer support.

Selected Answer: BD
B. Guest user and public access settings

Guest user and public access settings allow non-authenticated users (guest users) to access certain parts of the site without logging in. This feature is essential for enabling users to browse articles, blogs, manuals, FAQs, and ask/answer questions without requiring them to create an account.
D. Document Library Model (DLM)

The Document Library Model (DLM) is a feature that allows organizations to organize and manage documents efficiently within Experience Cloud sites. UC can use DLM to structure its content repository effectively, making it easy for users to access manuals, articles, and other resources.

comments.content: Options A (Content Delivery Network - CDN) and C (Public Site Connect) are not directly related to building out the site for users to access articles, blogs, manuals, FAQs, and ask/answer questions. CDN improves site performance by caching content closer to users, which may be beneficial but is not a primary focus for building out the site's functionality. Public Site Connect is a feature for integrating Experience Cloud sites with external websites or portals, which may not be necessary for UC's immediate requirements.

Enabling the setting "Let guest users view asset files and CMS content available to the site" in the Administration Workspace allows guest users to access and view images and other asset files that are available on the site. This setting grants permissions for guest users to see the content, including images, that is accessible to them without requiring them to log in. Therefore, enabling this setting would ensure that guest users can see images on the customer portal without needing to authenticate.
